channel.title: RealGM Basketball Wiretap
channel.description: Basketball News, Rumors, Scores, Stats, Analysis, Depth Charts, Forums

item.title: Warriors Expect Andre Iguodala To Play One More Season
item.description:
The Golden State Warriors expect Andre Iguodala to return for one more season in 2022-23. Iguodala intends to announce his decision on his podcast with Evan Turner in the next week or so.

Iguodala played 19.4 minutes per game over 31 regular season games last season. The veteran forward averaged 4.0 points, 3.2 rebounds and 3.7 assists in his 18th season.

The Warriors prize Iguodala for his veteran leadership. Despite battling injuries last season, Iguodala's presence helped Golden State through some rough patches during the season, including in the playoffs.

item.title: Knicks, Svi Mykhailiuk Agree To Partially Guaranteed Contract
item.description:
The New York Knicks and free agent wing Svi Mykhailiuk have agreed to a one-year contract. Mykhailiuk will sign a partially guaranteed deal and will compete for a roster spot in the preseason.

Mykhailiuk played last season with the Toronto Raptors. In 56 appearances, Mykhailiuk averaged 4.5 points in 12.8 minutes per game. Toronto waived Mykhailiuk earlier during the 2022 offseason.

The 6-foot-8 wing has played in 220 games in his four-year NBA career, including 46 starts. For his career, Mykhailiuk has averaged 6.6 points per game and has shot 35.3% on three-pointers.

item.title: Timberwolves, P.J. Dozier Agree To Contract
item.description:
The Minnesota Timberwolves and P.J. Dozier have agreed to a contract. Dozier is returning from a torn ACL suffered in December of 2021.

The veteran guard had claimed a rotation spot with the Denver Nuggets before he tore his ACL last season. This move reunites Dozier with former Nuggets President of Basketball Operations Tim Connelly, who now holds the same role with the Wolves.

For his career, Dozier has averaged 6.4 points in 105 NBA games. Dozier has played for the Oklahoma City Thunder and Boston Celtics, in addition to the Nuggets.

item.title: Pacers Sign Kendall Brown To Two-Way Contract
item.description:
The Indiana Pacers have signed Kendall Brown to a Two-Way contract. Brown was drafted with the 18th pick of the second round of the 2022 NBA Draft by the Minnesota Timberwolves before his rights were traded to Indiana.

In his lone season at Baylor, Brown started in all 34 games for the Bears. The 6-foot-8 wing averaged 9.7 points and 4.9 rebounds in 27 minutes per game.

item.title: Pacers Sign James Johnson, Bennie Boatwright, David Stockton, Gabe York To Camp Deals
item.description:
The Indiana Pacers have completed their training camp roster by signing a foursome of players. James Johnson, Bennie Boatwright, David Stockton and Gabe York all signed what are expected to be non-guaranteed training camp deals with Indiana.

Johnson is a 13-year NBA veteran. He appeared in 62 games for the Brooklyn Nets last season. In 19.2 minutes per game, Johnson averaged 5.5 points and 3.5 rebounds per game.

Boatwright was briefly with the Pacers last preseason, but did not appear in a game. Boatwright then played for the Fort Wayne Mad Ants of the G League before injuring his knee and missing the remainder of the season. The 6-foot-10 forward was a four-year starter at USC and averaged 18.2 points per game as a senior in 2018-19.

Stockton has appeared in six NBA games over two seasons with the Sacramento Kings and Utah Jazz. Last season, in 14 G League games with the Memphis Hustle, the 31-year-old point guard averaged 11.2 points and 4.2 assists per game.

York finished last season on a Two-Way contract with the Pacers. The combo guard appeared in two NBA games with Indiana. In 34 games with the Mad Ants of the G League, York averaged 21.7 points, 4.7 rebounds, 4.2 assists and 2.5 steals per game.

item.title: Bulls, Kostas Antetokounmpo Agree To Contract
item.description:
The Chicago Bulls have agreed to a contract with forward Kostas Antetokounmpo. Antetokounmpo will make a return to the NBA after playing in France last season.

The 6-foot-10 forward has played in 22 games over three NBA seasons with the Dallas Mavericks and Los Angeles Lakers. Antetokounmpo played with ASVEL Basket in France last season, before playing for Greece during EuroBasket this summer. In 52 appearances with ASVEL, Antetokounmpo averaged 4.9 points and 2.4 rebounds in 11.9 minutes per game.

Antetokounmpo is expected to keep for a Two-Way spot with Chicago. The Bulls are expected to have a Two-Way opening after rookie wing Justin Lewis tore his ACL during an offseason workout.

item.title: Knicks Re-Sign Ryan Arcidiacono
item.description:
The New York Knicks have re-signed Ryan Arcidiacono. Arcidiacono finished last season with the Knicks, after a handful of 10 Day contracts.

The veteran guard played 10 games for New York last season. Prior to that, he had played for the Maine Celtics of the G League.

Arcidiacono played the first four season of his career with the Chicago Bulls. In 217 NBA games, the point guard holds career averages of 4.6 points and 2.1 assists in 17.2 minutes per game.

item.title: Pistons Waive Keifer Sykes
item.description:
The Detroit Pistons have waived guard Keifer Sykes. Sykes was recently signed in a move designed to gain his G League rights for the Motor City Cruise.

Sykes appeared in 32 games (11 starts) for the Indiana Pacers last season. The 6-foot guard averaged 5.6 points for the Pacers. Sykes averaged 16.5 points, 4.3 rebounds and 7.5 assists for the Fort Wayne Mad Ants of the G League.

item.title: Jazz Waive Xavier Sneed, Paris Bass
item.description:
The Utah Jazz have waived Xavier Sneed from his Two-Way contract. Utah also waived the recently signed Paris Bass from his non-guaranteed training camp deal.

Sneed appeared in nine games between the Jazz and Memphis Grizzlies last season. The 6-foot-5 wing played in 15 G League games between the Salt Lake City Stars and the Greensboro Swarm. Sneed averaged 15.1 and 6.2 rebounds in the G League. He signed a two-year Two-Way deal with Utah in mid-February.

Bass was signed and almost immediately waived by the Jazz. This set of transactions was designed for Utah to acquire Bass' G League rights. He's expected to play for Salt Lake City during this upcoming G League season.

item.title: Bucks Sign And Waive Rob Edwards
item.description:
The Milwaukee Bucks have signed and waived guard Rob Edwards. This set of transactions was designed to get Edwards' G League rights for the Wisconsin Herd.

Edwards appeared in two NBA games for the Oklahoma City Thunder last season while on a hardship callup. In 32 G League games for the Oklahoma City Blue, Edwards averaged 13.3 points. The Arizona State product also averaged 4.4 rebounds per game.

item.title: Gary Payton II Underwent Surgery On Core Muscle, Expected To Fully Recover By Regular Season
item.description:
Gary Payton II underwent surgery in July to address a core muscle injury, according to the Portland Trail Blazers.

Payton is expected to be fully healthy by the start of the regular season.

The Blazers signed Payton to a three-year, $28 million deal this offseason.

item.title: Lakers Strongly Considering Bringing Russell Westbrook Off Bench
item.description:
The Los Angeles Lakers are strongly considering bringing Russell Westbrook off the bench this season, sources told Jovan Buha and Sam Amick of The Athletic.

The organization is willing to back any decision Darvin Ham ends up making regarding his rotation.

The news comes on the heels of the Lakers signing Dennis Schroder to a one-year deal on Friday. The team also traded for Patrick Beverley in late August.

Sources also added that it is becoming more and more likely that Westbrook will have role with the Lakers this season as training camp approaches.

item.title: Lakers, Dennis Schroder Agree To One-Year Contract
item.description:
The Los Angeles Lakers are going back to a familiar face to add some depth for the upcoming season. The Lakers and Dennis Schroder have agreed to a one-year, veteran minimum contract.

Schroder played in 61 games for Los Angeles during the 2020-21 season. The veteran point guard averaged 15.4 points and 5.7 assists in 32.1 minutes per game.

Last season, Schroder split the year between the Boston Celtics and Houston Rockets. Schroder joined Boston on the Taxpayer Mid-Level Exception, before being traded to Houston at the trade deadline.

This summer, Schroder has played well as one of the leaders for Germany during EuroBasket. Schroder helped lead the German team to the EuroBasket semi-finals, which sparked interest around the NBA in bringing him.

item.title: PayPal Won't Continue Jersey Sponsorship With Suns If Robert Sarver Remains With Team
item.description:
PayPal announced that it will not continue its jersey patch sponsorship with the Phoenix Suns should Robert Sarver continue in his role with the team at the end of his one-year suspension.

PayPal's deal with the Suns is set to expire after the 22-23 season and was worth $3 million during the 21-22 season.

"PayPal is a values-driven company and has a strong record of combatting racism, sexism and all forms of discrimination," PayPal CEO and president Dan Schulman said in a statement. "We have reviewed the report of the NBA league's independent investigation into Phoenix Suns owner Robert Sarver and have found his conduct unacceptable and in conflict with our values.

"... In light of the findings of the NBA's investigation, we will not renew our sponsorship should Robert Sarver remain involved with the Suns organization, after serving his suspension," Schulman said in his statement.

item.title: Knicks' Front Office Hierarchy Considered Confusing By League Sources
item.description:
The front office hierarchy of the New York Knicks under Leon Rose has been considered confusing by many league sources who spoke with Marc Berman of the New York Post. The confusion of who is in charge can get amplified during trade talks, which is why Rose put Gersson Rosas as the point man to communicate with Justin Zanik of the Utah Jazz on a Donovan Mitchell trade.

In addition to Rose and Rosas, the Knicks also have William Wesley, Brock Aller and Scott Perry in influential roles.

"Leon delegates too much - delegates to a fault," one coaching source said. "They had a breakaway layup and blew it."

The Knicks have also been inactive during each of the past two trade deadlines.

People around the league say Tom Thibodeau was disheartened when the Knicks were unable to trade for Mitchell.

item.title: Nets Sign Chris Chiozza
item.description:
The Brooklyn Nets have signed free agent guard Chris Chiozza.

Chiozza (5'11", 179) has seen action in 91 career NBA games (four starts) across four seasons with Golden State (2021-22), Brooklyn (2020, 2020-21), Washington (2019) and Houston (2019), averaging 3.3 points, 1.3 rebounds and 2.4 assists in 11.4 minutes per game. The Memphis, Tenn., native returns to the Nets after spending the 2021-22 season with the Warriors, appearing in 34 games (one start) with the 2022 NBA champions and averaging 2.0 points, 1.1 rebounds and 1.9 assists in 10.9 minutes per contest. In 40 games (three starts) over his two seasons in Brooklyn, Chiozza posted averages of 5.1 points, 1.6 rebounds and 3.0 assists in 12.8 minutes per game while shooting 39.2 percent from the field, 44.8 percent from 3-point range and 81.8 percent from the free-throw line. He also appeared in and started 10 games with the Long Island Nets, Brooklyn's NBA G League affiliate, during the 2019-20 season and has appeared in 70 career NBA G League games (68 starts) across three seasons with Santa Cruz, Long Island, Capital City and Rio Grande Valley, registering averages of 13.0 points, 4.8 rebounds, 7.5 assists and 2.0 steals in 33.1 minutes per contest.

item.title: David Duke Jr. Re-Signs With Nets On Two-Way Contract
item.description:
The Brooklyn Nets have re-signed David Duke Jr. to a Two-Way contract.

Duke appeared in 22 games last season with the Nets, averaging 4.7 points and 3.1 rebounds in 15.5 minutes.

Duke also played in 13 G League games, averaging 16.2 points, 6.3 rebounds and 3.1 assists in 29.5 minutes.

item.title: Javonte Smart, Pelicans Agree To Exhibit 10 Deal
item.description:
The New Orleans Pelicans have agreed to sign Javonte Smart to an Exhibit 10 deal.

Smart spent last season on Two-Way contracts with the Milwaukee Bucks and Miami Heat.

Smart went undrafted in 2021 out of LSU.

item.title: Hawks To Sign Malik Ellison To Camp Deal
item.description:
The Atlanta Hawks are set to sign Malik Ellison. It's expected that Ellison will sign a non-guaranteed training camp deal with Atlanta.

The 6-foot-6 wing was with the Hawks last season on a hardship callup, but did not appear in an NBA game. In 25 G League games with the College Park Skyhawks, Ellison averaged 7.1 points and 4.9 rebounds per game.

item.title: NBA, National Basketball Referees Association Agree To New Collective Bargaining Agreement
item.description:
The NBA and the National Basketball Referees Association entered a new collective bargaining agreement lasting through the 2028-29 season on Thursday.

The previous agreement expired at the end of the 2021-22 season.

The new agreement addressed issues surrounding salary, travel, and pension, and was ratified by the overwhelming majority of refs.

"The league has made clear that they value the contributions we make to the game's integrity, and we look forward to a long and prosperous relationship together. We are all excited to start the new season," said NBRA board member and veteran official Marc Davis.

item.title: Suns' Minority Owner Jahm Najafi Calls For Robert Sarver's Resignation
item.description:
Phoenix Suns vice chairman and minority owner Jahm Najafi called for Robert Sarver's resignation in an open letter to team employees on Thursday night.

Najafi is the second-largest stakeholder in the team.

"I cannot in good judgment sit back and allow our children and future generations of fans to think that this behavior is tolerated because of wealth and privilege. Therefore, in accordance with my commitment to helping eradicate any form of racism, sexism and bias, as Vice Chairman of the Phoenix Suns, I am calling for the resignation of Robert Sarver," wrote Najafi in the letter.

Najafi added that he had no interest in becoming the managing partner of the team.

Sarver was suspended for one year and fined $10 million following an investigation into toxic workplace issues under his ownership.

The league granted minority owner Sam Garvin the authority to act as interim governor.

item.title: NBA Grants Suns Minority Owner Sam Garvin Authority To Act As Interim Governor
item.description:
The NBA granted Phoenix Suns vice chairman and minority owner Sam Garvin the authority to act as the team's interim governor during Robert Sarver's year-long suspension, reported Baxter Holmes and Zach Lowe of ESPN.

Sarver was suspended for one year and fined $10 million following an investigation into toxic workplace issues under his ownership.

Garvin, who has been a minority owner since 2004, became the team's alternate governor in 2007.

Sources told ESPN that Sarver would work with the league to appoint an interim governor for the team.

Sarver also reportedly did not accept the idea that he deserved to be punished and became "acrimonious" during the punitive part of the investigation.

item.title: RealGM Radio: Rob Mahoney, Matt Moore On The Southwest Division (2022)
item.description:
Host Danny Leroux (@DannyLeroux), Rob Mahoney of The Ringer (@RobMahoney) and Matt Moore of The Action Network (@HPBasketball) go in-depth on the NBA's Southwest Division.

They discuss how the Rockets, Pelicans, Spurs, Mavericks and Grizzlies fared in the off-season, including which teams improved and what moves stood out. The three also predict the season to come, including projected finish, breakout players and rookies they are most excited to see. Also, Danny pays tribute to his friend Jonathan Tjarks.

Subscribe to RealGM Radio on Apple Podcasts or via the RSS feed.

item.title: Keifer Sykes, Pistons Sign Exhibit 10 Deal
item.description:
The Detroit Pistons have signed Keifer Sykes to an Exhibit 10 deal.

Sykes appeared in 32 games last season with the Pacers, averaging 5.6 points, 1.4 rebounds and 1.9 assists in 17.7 minutes.

Sykes, who went undrafted out of Green Bay in 2015, had largely played overseas before his NBA debut last season.

item.title: Damian Lillard: I Do Plan On Being A Trail Blazer For Life
item.description:
While on The Dave Pasch Podcast, Damian Lillard was asked about his future with the Portland Trail Blazers. Lillard was clear when asked if he hopes to be with Portland for his entire career.

"Yes, I do (plan on being a Blazer for life)," Lillard said. "I've had my share of people saying 'Man, you got to get out of there! You've got to do this; you've got do to that.' But I'm the type of person that I'm never going to be marching to the beat of nobody else's drum."

Lillard went on to say he follows his heart. He added that he's loyal to the Trail Blazers organization.

"I'm gonna always do what I feel like is in my best interest and that I really feel in my heart," Lillard said. "I've said this on many different occasions, they call it 'He's being loyal!' and 'Loyalty this, loyalty that' and I'm like, I'm naturally a loyal person but I do have a level of loyalty to the organization. But this loyalty that they're talking about is ultimately to who I am as a person. I'm being loyal to who I am and not getting beside myself because I'm somebody that, I believe what I believe."

Lillard said he knows many think he needs to leave Portland to win a championship. But he believes that he can win at the highest levels with the Trail Blazers.

"I think I can get it done. Now, everybody else might say 'There's no way the Blazers will ever win. They need to do this, they need to do that.' But that's just not how I feel about the situation," Lillard said. "I feel like we'll have a chance to win, I feel like that moment is going to come, I feel like that opportunity is going to come. And that's that."

item.title: Lakers, Jazz Talking Bojan Bogdanovic Trade
item.description:
After trading Rudy Gobert and Donovan Mitchell, the Utah Jazz are exploring the trade market for the remaining veterans on their roster. Utah has talked trades with rival teams involving Bojan Bogdanovic, Mike Conley, Jordan Clarkson, Rudy Gay and Malik Beasley.

In particular, the Jazz have held ongoing talks with the Los Angeles Lakers surrounding Bojan Bogdanovic. The veteran forward averaged 18.1 points on 45/39/86 shooting splits a season ago.

Utah and Los Angeles have already linked up for one deal this offseason. The Lakers sent Talen Horton-Tucker and Stanley Johnson to the Jazz in exchange for Patrick Beverley. Landing Bogdanovic would go a long way towards adding depth to the Lakers rotation.

The challenge is Los Angeles may find it difficult to match salary in a trade for Bogdanovic. In part, that may be why Utah isn't close to trading Bogdanovic at this time.

item.title: Get Your Latest NBA News From RealGM's Basketball Wiretap
item.description: Get all the latest news and happenings from around the NBA with RealGM's Basketball Wiretap.
